title: Brain-Computer Interface-Based Neurofeedback Training: Personalized Cognitive Regulation Skill Development

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary computer literacy and general understanding of neuroscience
context.additional_context: Practical training program for workplace stress management and cognitive enhancement for professionals, with real-time feedback via personal BCI devices (e.g., EMG headsets)

learning_goals: Learners can analyze their own brainwave patterns in real-time through a brain-computer interface (BCI) system.
Learners can perform personalized neurofeedback training at individually tailored difficulty levels using training modules based on the Zone of Proximal Development (ZPD).
Learners can apply BCI-based self-regulation techniques (e.g., maintaining focused states) with 80% or greater accuracy.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
